author: Matthew Dalton
title: L’Oréal Would Pay to Disentangle Itself From Nestlé
text:
PARIS—Cosmetics giant L’Oréal SA said it has the financial firepower to buy the roughly $27 billion worth of its stock held by Nestlé SA, opening the door to negotiations over how to decouple two of the world’s biggest consumer-goods companies.
“If one day Nestlé decides that they want to sell part of their shares or their shares, obviously we would be a buyer,” L’Oréal Chief Executive Jean-Paul Agon said in an interview. “And obviously, we would buy them to cancel them.”
...
